ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would summarize this course as a conglomerate of different topics and lecturers, with both formal lectures and paper discussion. I would highly recommend this course to graduate students interested in any aspect of bacteriology, as many of the topics covered are applicable beyond just pathogenesis. Although parasitology and virology are not mentioned at all within the class, I might also recommend this course to first year graduate students interested in those subjects because of the paper discussions; I learned a lot about critical reading from this course.
I would recommend this course. It was a great introductory course that gave a broad exposure of topics in microbiology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me a better understanding of several topics within bacterial pathogenesis. Perhaps more importantly, I felt that this class helped me to read papers more thoroughly and more critically. Overall, I think this course will contribute significantly to my future research.
Broad exposure to various research topics
